title: Aloo Tamatar Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, red chili, and coriander powder. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add boiled potatoes, salt, and water. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with puri or rice.

title: Bhindi Masala
instructions: Heat oil and sauté cumin seeds, then onions until golden.
Add tomatoes and spices, cook until soft.
Add bhindi and stir well. Cover and cook on low heat until tender.
Sprinkle garam masala, mix well, and serve hot.

title: Baingan Bharta
instructions: Roast the eggplant until skin chars. Peel and mash it.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds and sauté onions.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili. Cook till fragrant.
Add tomatoes and spices. Cook till oil separates.
Add mashed eggplant, mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Lauki Tamatar Curry
instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds.
Add onions and sauté till golden. Add ginger paste and cook.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook until soft.
Add lauki, salt, and water. Cover and cook until tender.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

title: Tinda Masala
instructions: Heat oil and sauté cumin seeds and onions.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook till soft.
Add chopped tinda and salt. Add a little water, cover and cook until soft.
Sprinkle garam masala and mix well. Serve hot.

title: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds, and sauté onions.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and spices. Cook till tomatoes soften.
Add potatoes and cauliflower. Mix well and cook covered until tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve hot.

title: Aloo Baingan Curry
instructions: Heat oil and sauté cumin seeds and onions.
Add ginger paste, turmeric, and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add potatoes and eggplant. Add salt and mix well.
Cover and cook until vegetables are soft.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve hot.

title: Kaddu ki Sabzi
instructions: Heat oil and sauté cumin seeds and onions.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, and chili powder. Cook until soft.
Add pumpkin, salt, and little water. Cook covered until tender.
Add jaggery for a sweet touch (optional) and mix well.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Gobi Masala
instructions: Blanch cauliflower and set aside.
Heat oil, sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste and cook.
Add tomatoes and spices, cook until oil separates.
Add cauliflower, mix well and cook for 10–12 minutes.
Serve hot with chapati or rice.

title: Aloo Matar
instructions: Heat oil, sauté cumin seeds and onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook till fragrant.
Add tomatoes and spices. Cook till soft.
Add potatoes and peas. Add water and salt. Cook until soft.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve hot.

title: Matar Paneer
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook till raw smell disappears.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook until oil separates.
Add green peas and cook for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes, salt, and some water. Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander before serving.

title: Lauki Chana Dal Curry
instructions: Soak chana dal for 1 hour and pressure cook until soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, and sauté onions.
Add ginger paste, tomatoes, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook until soft.
Add lauki and cooked dal with water. Simmer until lauki is soft.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Methi Aloo
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and sauté.
Add potatoes and turmeric. Cook until half done.
Add methi leaves and cook until potatoes are tender.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve hot with chapati.

title: Bharwa Bhindi
instructions: Mix besan with spices and salt to make stuffing.
Stuff the bhindi with this mixture.
Heat oil and place the stuffed bhindi gently in the pan.
Cook on low heat, turning occasionally, until bhindi is tender.
Serve hot with roti or dal rice.

title: Rajma Masala
instructions: Pressure cook soaked rajma until soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds and sauté onions.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
Add tomato puree and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked rajma, simmer for 10–15 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Chana Masala
instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas until soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds and onions. Cook until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add chickpeas and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with bhature or rice.

title: Kala Chana Curry
ingredients: 1 cup black chickpeas (kala chana), soaked overnight
instructions: Pressure cook soaked kala chana until soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, sauté onions, then add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes and spices, cook until soft.
Add cooked kala chana and simmer for 10–15 minutes.
Serve with roti or rice.

title: Palak Aloo
instructions: Heat oil and sauté cumin seeds and onions.
Add ginger paste, tomatoes, and turmeric. Cook till soft.
Add potatoes and cook halfway.
Add chopped spinach and cook till everything is tender.
Serve hot with chapati or rice.

title: Tamatar Bhindi
instructions: Heat oil and sauté cumin seeds and onions.
Add tomatoes and spices, cook until soft.
Add bhindi and cook on low heat until tender.
Serve hot with roti or paratha.

title: Ghiya Kofta Curry
instructions: Mix grated ghiya with besan and salt. Shape into small balls (koftas).
Deep-fry until golden and set aside.
Heat oil, sauté onion, then add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree.
Add turmeric and garam masala. Cook till oil separates.
Add water to make gravy, bring to a boil, and gently add koftas.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

title: Shahi Paneer
instructions: Soak cashews in warm water for 15 minutes and grind to a paste.
Heat ghee, sauté onions until golden, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, and cook until oil separates.
Add cashew paste, cream, garam masala, and mix well.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or paratha.

title: Kadai Paneer
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions, capsicum, and paneer lightly. Set aside.
In the same pan, sauté ginger-garlic paste and add tomato puree.
Add turmeric, chili powder, and kadai masala. Cook until thick.
Add sautéed paneer and veggies back to the pan and mix well.
Cook for 5 minutes and serve hot with roti.

title: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Heat butter, sauté onion until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until thick.
Add turmeric, chili powder, garam masala and cream. Mix well.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or paratha.

title: Palak Paneer
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and sauté onions.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato, cook until soft.
Add spinach puree, salt, garam masala and mix.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Top with cream and serve with rice or roti.

title: Paneer Do Pyaza
instructions: Sauté cumin seeds and onions in oil until soft.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add paneer and remaining onion slices. Stir well.
Simmer for a few minutes and serve with roti or rice.

title: Matar Paneer
instructions: Sauté onion and ginger-garlic paste in oil.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, coriander powder. Cook until thick.
Add peas and simmer until soft.
Add paneer and garam masala. Cook for 5 minutes.
Serve with rice or chapati.

title: Malai Kofta
instructions: Mix paneer, potato, salt and shape into koftas. Deep fry and set aside.
Heat oil, sauté ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree.
Add turmeric, garam masala, cashew paste, and cream.
Simmer the gravy, then add koftas gently.
Serve hot with naan or pulao.

title: Khoya Paneer
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onion, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, and cook till oil separates.
Add grated khoya and mix well.
Add paneer and garam masala. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with roti or paratha.

title: Achari Paneer
instructions: Heat oil and add fennel, mustard, and nigella seeds.
Sauté onion and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, and salt. Cook till soft.
Add paneer and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with paratha or rice.

title: Mushroom Masala
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, then tomato puree and spices.
Cook until oil separates, then add mushrooms.
Simmer until mushrooms are cooked through.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Mushroom Matar Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, coriander powder and cook until oil separates.
Add mushrooms and green peas. Cook until tender.
Sprinkle garam masala, mix well, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Mushroom Do Pyaza
instructions: Heat oil and sauté half the sliced onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder and cook until soft.
Add mushrooms and remaining raw onion slices. Mix and cook.
Sprinkle garam masala, cook for a couple more minutes.
Serve hot with chapati or naan.

title: Palak Mushroom
instructions: Heat oil and sauté cumin seeds and onions.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato, cook until soft.
Add spinach puree and mix well.
Add mushrooms, salt, and garam masala. Cook until mushrooms are tender.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve with roti or rice.

title: Kadai Mushroom
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions and capsicum until slightly soft.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add kadai masala, chili powder, and mix well.
Add mushrooms and stir-fry until cooked through.
Simmer for a few minutes and serve hot.

title: Egg Curry (Punjabi Style)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, coriander, and chili powder. Cook until oil separates.
Add water to adjust consistency, then add boiled eggs.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes and add garam masala.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve hot.

title: Egg Masala Curry
instructions: Heat oil and crackle cumin seeds.
Add onions and sauté till golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté for a minute.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, and cook till oil separates.
Add boiled eggs and masala. Mix well and simmer.
Garnish and serve hot with rice or chapati.

title: Egg Do Pyaza
instructions: Heat oil and sauté half the onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped tomato. Cook well.
Add turmeric, coriander powder, and mix well.
Add the rest of the raw onion slices and mix.
Add boiled eggs and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Finish with garam masala and serve.

title: Dhaba-style Egg Curry
instructions: Heat oil and fry onions until deep golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until fragrant.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder and cook till oil separates.
Add boiled eggs and some water. Cook for 8-10 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Achari Anda Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil, crackle mustard, fennel, and nigella seeds.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped tomatoes.
Add turmeric, chili powder and cook till oil separates.
Add boiled eggs and cook in the masala for 5-7 minutes.
Serve with paratha or rice.

title: Egg Butter Masala
instructions: Melt butter and sauté onions until soft.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add turmeric, chili powder and salt.
Add cream and mix well.
Add boiled eggs and simmer for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve hot.

title: Mughlai Egg Curry (Rich & Creamy)
instructions: Heat ghee and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, then stir in yogurt slowly.
Add cashew paste and cook until thick.
Add cream, garam masala, and saffron if using.
Add boiled eggs and simmer gently.
Serve hot with naan or pulao.

title: Tandoori Egg Curry
instructions: Marinate boiled eggs in tandoori masala and yogurt for 30 mins.
Grill or pan-fry eggs until slightly charred.
Heat oil, sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and cook till oil separates.
Add grilled eggs to the gravy and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with roti or rice.

title: Egg Bhurji Curry
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions and green chili.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato. Cook until soft.
Add turmeric and garam masala.
Crack in the eggs and scramble until cooked.
Add water if desired for curry-like consistency.
Garnish and serve hot.

title: Egg & Aloo Curry
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices.
Add potatoes and cook until almost tender.
Add boiled eggs and water. Simmer until potatoes are fully cooked.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve.

title: Egg & Palak Curry
instructions: Blanch spinach in hot water for 2 minutes, drain, and blend to a puree.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add the spinach puree and cook for 5-6 minutes.
Add water to adjust the consistency and bring to a boil.
Make small slits in the boiled eggs and add to the gravy.
Sprinkle garam masala and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Egg Curry with Methi (Fenugreek Leaves)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili. Cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, coriander, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add chopped methi leaves and sauté for 3-4 minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Make slits in the boiled eggs and add to the curry.
Simmer for 5-6 minutes, then sprinkle garam masala.
Serve hot with chapati or rice.

title: Kashmiri Egg Rogan Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil until it reaches smoking point, then cool slightly.
Add cumin seeds and asafoetida, then sauté onions until golden.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Lower heat and stir in whisked curd gradually, stirring continuously.
Add chili powder, fennel powder, ginger powder, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add water for desired consistency and bring to a boil.
Make slits in the boiled eggs and add them to the curry.
Simmer for 8-10 minutes, sprinkle garam masala.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt for 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until half-cooked. Set aside.
In a pan, heat butter and oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add cream, sugar, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the grilled chicken and cook until done.
Garnish with cream or coriander and serve hot with naan.

title: Kadai Chicken
instructions: Heat oil in a kadai, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add all dry spices and cook till oil separates.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add bell pepper and a splash of water; cover and cook until chicken is done.
Garnish with kasuri methi and serve with roti or rice.

title: Chicken Masala (Punjabi style)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree, spices, and cook until oil separates.
Add yogurt, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add chicken, cover, and cook until tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

title: Chicken Do Pyaza
instructions: Heat oil, sauté chopped onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, cook for 2 mins.
Add tomatoes and all dry spices; cook till oil separates.
Add chicken and cook until nearly done.
Add cubed onions and cook for 5 minutes.
Garnish and serve hot.

title: Chicken Korma
instructions: Fry onions until crisp and golden. Blend to a paste.
Heat oil, add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.
Add chicken and cook until sealed.
Add yogurt, spices, and onion paste. Mix well.
Add cashew paste and cook for 10-15 minutes.
Add cream, simmer for 5 minutes, and serve hot.

title: Dhaba Style Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil until smoky, then cool slightly.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and spices; cook until oil separates.
Add chicken, mix well, and cook covered until tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve hot.

title: Achari Chicken
ingredients: 1 tbsp achar masala or pickling spices
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add mustard and fennel seeds.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices.
Add chicken and cook until tender.
Add achar masala, mix well and cook for 5 more minutes.
Serve with roti or rice.

title: Palak Chicken
instructions: Heat oil, sauté cumin and onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and spices, cook until oil separates.
Add chicken and cook till half done.
Add spinach puree, mix well, and cook until chicken is tender.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Chicken Bhuna Masala
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and onions. Sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add all spices and cook until oil separates.
Add chicken and bhuno (sauté) on high heat until well coated and cooked.
Reduce heat and cook covered until chicken is tender.
Serve dry or with little gravy as desired.

title: Amritsari Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil until smoky, cool slightly.
Add onions and sauté till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and all dry spices.
Add yogurt and cook until oil separates.
Add chicken, mix well and cook covered until tender.
Sprinkle amchur before serving. Serve hot with naan or rice.

title: Rajasthani Red Chicken Curry
instructions: Soak red chilies in warm water and grind to a paste.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chili paste. Cook well.
Add tomatoes, yogurt, and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add chicken and cook covered until tender.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Rajasthani Red Chicken Curry
instructions: Soak red chilies in warm water and grind to a paste.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chili paste. Cook well.
Add tomatoes, yogurt, and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add chicken and cook covered until tender.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Mutton Do Pyaza
instructions: Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies; cook for 2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili, and coriander powder; cook until oil separates.
Add mutton pieces and salt; cook until browned.
Add water, cover, and pressure cook for 20-25 minutes.
Once done, open the lid, add garam masala and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

title: Saag Gosht (Spinach Mutton Curry)
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies; cook for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, cumin, and red chili powder. Cook until mushy.
Add mutton and salt; sauté until browned.
Add water, cover and cook until mutton is tender (pressure cook if needed).
Add spinach puree and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add garam masala and mix well.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: UP-style Tari Mutton Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil until it smokes, then cool slightly.
Add whole spices, then sliced onions; sauté until deep brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and powdered spices; cook till oil separates.
Add mutton and salt; cook until well-sealed with masala.
Add water and cook until mutton is tender.
Adjust gravy consistency to keep it runny (tari).
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Achari Mutton
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add all the achari spices and let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and powdered spices; cook until oil separates.
Add curd and mix well.
Add mutton and salt; cook until sealed.
Add water, cover and cook until tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Dhaba-style Mutton Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy pan, sauté onions until deeply browned.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies; cook for a minute.
Add tomatoes and spices; cook until oil separates.
Add mutton and salt; cook on high heat until sealed and coated.
Add water, reduce heat, and slow cook until tender (or pressure cook).
Finish with garam masala and garnish with coriander.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

title: Amritsari Fish Curry
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (preferably river fish like rohu or catla)
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan until smoking, fry the fish lightly and set aside.
In the same oil, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and powdered spices, cook until oil separates.
Add whisked curd and stir continuously for 2-3 minutes.
Add some water and bring the curry to a boil.
Add fried fish, simmer for 8–10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with rice.

title: Punjabi Mustard Fish Curry
ingredients: 2 tbsp mustard seeds (yellow and black mixed)
instructions: Grind mustard seeds with green chilies and a little water to make a paste.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add chopped tomato, turmeric, and red chili powder; cook until mushy.
Add mustard paste and cook for 2–3 minutes.
Add water and salt, bring to a boil.
Gently slide in fish pieces, simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve with steamed rice.

title: Sarson Fish Curry
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat mustard oil till it smokes, fry the fish lightly and set aside.
In the same oil, add nigella seeds and green chilies.
Add mustard paste, red chili powder, and a little water; cook for 2 minutes.
Add water to make gravy, bring to boil.
Add fried fish and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Fish Tikka Masala Curry
instructions: Marinate fish with yogurt, lemon juice, turmeric, red chili, and tikka masala for 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry fish until lightly charred and cooked.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and spices; cook until oil separates.
Add grilled fish pieces and simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Garnish and serve with naan or rice.

title: Fish & Potato Curry (Uttar Pradesh style)
instructions: Marinate fish with salt and turmeric; set aside for 15 minutes.
Fry potatoes until golden and set aside.
Heat mustard oil, fry fish pieces lightly and remove.
In same oil, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped tomatoes; cook till soft.
Add powdered spices and cook till oil separates.
Add fried potatoes and water; bring to boil.
Add fried fish, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Kashmiri Fish Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil until smoking; reduce heat and add asafoetida.
Add turmeric, chili powder, fennel powder, and ginger powder. Stir briefly.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Add fish pieces and salt. Cook on medium flame for 10–12 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and simmer for 2 more minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Egg & Chicken Mixed Curry
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until oil separates.
Add chicken and cook until sealed.
Add water and simmer for 15–20 minutes until chicken is cooked.
Add boiled eggs and garam masala. Cook for 5 more minutes.
Garnish and serve with rice or roti.

title: Chicken Keema Curry
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomatoes and all dry spices. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add chicken keema and mix well.
Cook covered on medium heat for 15–20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add garam masala and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish and serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Anda Keema Curry
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add keema and cook for 15–20 minutes, adding water as needed.
Add boiled eggs, simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve with paratha or rice.

title: Prawn Masala (Punjab style)
instructions: Marinate prawns with turmeric and salt for 10 minutes.
Heat mustard oil and add cumin seeds.
Sauté onions till golden brown, then add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add prawns and cook for 5–7 minutes until done.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice or chapati.
